# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_cpd`
* Variable label: `History of chronic pulmonary disorders`
* Variable description: `history of chronic pulmonary disease`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | NO chronic pulmonary disease
1        | chronic pulmonary disease

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing



<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of chronic pulmonary disorders"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
datafolder <- "../RData/"

```

# Data process




## Ireland


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description



| **Name** | `ph301_01` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Has a doctor ever told you that you have any of the following conditions?: Chronic lung disease such as chronic bronchitis or emphysema`|
| **Table name**  | `TILDA-AMF-v16`|
| **Categories** |`0 = NOT Chronic lung disease such as chronic bronchitis or emphysema`<br/>`1 = Chronic lung disease such as chronic bronchitis or emphysema` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'TILDA_w1','TILDA.TILDA-AMF-v16',variables=list('ph301_01'), missings = T)
TILDA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'TILDA_w1')

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- TILDA_w1$ph301_01
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(TILDA_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(TILDA_w1, aes(x=factor(ph301_01))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_cpd` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `ph301_01 == 0  into 0`
* `ph301_01 == 1 into 1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
TILDA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=TILDA_w1$id)
TILDA_ds_w1$h_cpd <-TILDA_w1$ph301_01

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- TILDA_ds_w1$h_cpd
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(TILDA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(h_cpd))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(TILDA_ds_w1$h_cpd)
BeforeH <- table(TILDA_w1$ph301_01)
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0->0","1->1")
kable(C)

```

<!-- # Save -->
```{r save, include=FALSE, echo=F}

l.TILDA <- list(w1 = TILDA_ds_w1)

for(index in seq_along(l.TILDA)){
  h_cpd <- l.TILDA[[index]]
  save(h_cpd, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.TILDA)[index],"/h_cpd.RData"))
}

```
